static.description: Primary residence: small one-story, three-bedroom stucco house in Las Cruces, NM, east side near the old high school.
static.location: Las Cruces, New Mexico, east side near the old high school

timeline.citation: CLIENT: [00:04:49] I looked on Zillow. It said maybe three hundred to three‑fifty, something like that.
CLIENT: [00:04:35] No mortgage. My husband and I paid it off around 2008. It’s been free and clear for a while.

static.description: 50% ownership of a two-bedroom condo near the university in Flagstaff, AZ, inherited from sister. Niece owns the other half.

timeline.citation: CLIENT: [00:05:41] Half a condo in Flagstaff—who owns the other half? CLIENT: [00:05:45] My niece.
CLIENT: [00:06:08] The realtor said maybe two hundred, two‑twenty.
CLIENT: [00:06:08] The realtor said maybe two hundred, two‑twenty. So my half would be around a hundred or so.
CLIENT: [00:05:56] It’s paid off. My sister was very proud of that.
CLIENT: [00:06:20] Total rent is six or seven hundred a month, so I see about three hundred‑ish.

static.description: Inherited IRA from Miguel's old job at Fidelity. Monthly RMDs set up.

timeline.citation: CLIENT: [00:09:30] Last year it was around six hundred. This year it’s closer to, I think, six‑eighty, six‑ninety a month.
CLIENT: [00:09:19] Yes. They told me I had to start taking a “required” amount. The RMD. We set it up as a monthly payment.

timeline.citation: CLIENT: [00:10:24] Last time I looked—it was late last year—it was around eighty‑something thousand. Maybe eighty‑four, eighty‑five.
CLIENT: [00:10:35] Yes, just the RMD. They took about four thousand‑something last year. Once a year, they send it to my checking. I don’t touch the rest.
